intro: Fimbristylis armerioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded soils, often found in marshes, swales, and along stream banks. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers that are usually pale green to brown in color. It plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates. Fimbristylis armerioides is widely distributed across tropical and subtropical regions of the world.
